item.title: Complete Marvel Rivals Achievements & Trophies List Guide
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/complete-marvel-rivals-achievements-trophies-list-guide/

Marvel Rivals’ Trophies and Achievements require you to explore the furthest reaches of the roster to succeed. You need to master magicians and punish purveyors of chaos, so let’s take you through the whole Marvel Rivals list.

A free-to-play hero shooter sounds like a tired concept. Everything now is free-to-play, live service, and rich with cosmetics and microtransactions. Yet, Marvel Rivals has cracked the code: Enticing 10 million players in the first three days and teasing a big list of leaked characters still to come.

It has game modes galore, a multitude of multiplayer maps, and also a hefty list of extra tasks. The Marvel Rivals Achievement and Trophies list is close to being Galactus-sized, and it needs you to keep your gameplay interesting.

How Many Trophies & Achievements in Marvel Rivals?

Marvel Rivals has 41 PlayStation Trophies and a reduced figure of 40 Xbox Achievements—meaning you’ve got to be the most super of superheroes to get them all!

Trophy hunters and Achievement hoarders know the Platinum Trophy is the difference between PlayStation and Xbox. Getting every Achievement on Xbox comes with a personal smug look of satisfaction, whereas blue-brand players claim a converted Platinum Trophy. Either way, Rivals’ list is sure to take some time, and there’s a reason.

Every Marvel Rivals Achievement & Trophy

Near enough every Marvel Rivals Trophy and Achievement needs you to achieve an incredible feat using one of the F2P shooter’s many launch characters. I think it’s a great idea as the objectives are doable and logical, and encourage you to try out every hero.

Without further ado, here’s every Marvel Rivals Achievement and Trophy in its long list.

item.title: Conan the Barbarian Joins Mortal Kombat 1 in January 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/conan-the-barbarian-joins-mortal-kombat-1-in-january-2025/

It has been officially announced that Conan the Barbarian will join Mortal Kombat 1 on January 21, 2025.

The announcement came from Ed Boon on X (formerly Twitter), which showed a brief snippet of Conan the Barbarian in action.

According to leakers, Conan the Barbarian and T-1000 from Terminator 2 are some of the last characters to be coming to the Mortal Kombat 1 roster. Rumors suggest that Kombat Pack 3 and the second-story expansion for Mortal Kombat 1 have since been canceled due to poor expansion sales. Several Mortal Kombat insiders have since corroborated the claims since the original rumor.

Insider Gaming has contacted NetherRealm Studios for comment on the claims.

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Update Adds Boss Rush Mode and New Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/latest-black-myth-wukong-update-boss-rush-mode/

In the latest Black Myth: Wukong update, which is being deployed later today, players will be invited to take part in a new ‘boss rush’ challenge mode. This mode is split into two branches, and it’ll see players select former opponents to battle across a range of difficulty levels.

Game Science also revealed a new ‘Journeyer’s Chart’ mechanic, as well as a fresh set of armour, a new soundtrack application, and dozens of bug fixes.

Read on for the full scope of the next Black Myth: Wukong update.

Prepare for a Challenge

Per an update published by Game Science, the new boss rush mode introduces two core challenges:

  • Return of Rivals
  • Gauntlet of Legends

In Return of Rivals, players are invited to fight past opponents, tweaking the difficulty settings to suit their abilities.

In Gauntlet of Legends, players can undertake a journey, fighting multiple boss characters in succession using a series of customised curses to alter gameplay elements. It was noted that some old bosses will appear with fresh movesets, just to keep players on their toes.

By completing the Gauntlet of Legends, players will unlock rare treasures, including curios, medicine, equipment, and up to three new weapons.

The ‘Journeyer’s Chart’ isn’t immediately obvious, but here’s the description from the blog update:

  • A remarkable one has captured these landscapes, organizing them into charts for guidance and marking.
  • A Journeyer’s Chart can be unlocked when the Destined One first enters Black Wind Mountain and meets the Keeper.
  • Afterwards, for each new territory reached, a “Journeyer’s Chart” can be purchased at the Keeper’s Shrine.

Also, Game Science has introduced a new equipment set – the ‘Set of Opulence’, which has been designed to celebrate the impending Chinese New Year. Elsewhere, players can use the Black Myth: Wukong Soundtrack Selection feature to enjoy the game’s OST more intricately.

These updates have been made in addition to dozens of changes and bug fixes, along with further localisation tweaks, such as Turkish language support.

The update – 1.0.12.16581 – is available today on PC and PS5.
